title: 111_hr3901
content: The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" is the short title of the Act. It includes provisions to enhance the administration of the first-time homebuyer tax credit. The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" amends the age limitation for the tax credit, stating that taxpayers must be at least 18 years old at the time of purchasing a residence to qualify for the credit. The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" changes the age requirement for the tax credit, requiring taxpayers or their spouses to meet the age requirement. Amendments are made to subsection (g) and documentation requirements in section 36 of the Code. The "Homebuyer Tax Credit Improvement Act of 2009" amends documentation requirements for the first-time homebuyer tax credit, including restrictions on married individuals acquiring a residence from the family of their spouse. Certain errors related to the tax credit are treated as mathematical or clerical errors.
